issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Please note: I have marked this bug as Major even though it is an easy fix, because I wasted two days unable to launch instances on my cloud because I never imagined unused but allocated EIPs would count against my total of IPs. This seems really confusing, and a more helpful message is low-hanging fruit that could really ease a user's pain. Once I knew what to do, I was able to proceed again immediately. 

Original description: Not sure at all what is going on here. This cloud *was* working (http://10.111.5.153:8888) and now suddenly it won't let me launch instances or start stopped BFEBS instances. 

I get an error message that says "Not enough resources available: addresses (try --addressing private)" when doing launch instance and "Failed to send message StartInstancesType to service EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Not enough resources available: addresses (try --addressing private) " when trying to start a BFEBS stopped instance, but I have two available EIPs and no other instances running on this cloud. I should have plenty of addresses?

Update: Turns out the root cause here was that I had allocated, but unassociated EIPs in an account, and another account was running stances, and so there were no IPs to assign. If the cloud won't assign an unassociated EIP, at the very least the error message here could indicate that the user could terminate other instances or release unassociated EIPs to the cloud. 

A message like "Not enough resources available: addresses (please terminate unwanted instances or release unassociated elastic IPs to the cloud and try again, or try --addressing private)"
fields.summary: error message when no available addresses needs path to recovery please

comments.body: that "Not enough resources available: addresses" message tells me you have too many IPs allocated. By default, I think the QA boxes get 4 public IPs. So, having a combination of instances running and elastic IPs allocated can use those up quickly.

I just logged into that system and this is what I see for addresses;

[root@g-12-01 ~]# euca-describe-addresses verbose
ADDRESS	10.111.101.142	i-9429a89e (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.101.143	i-9fd04cfe (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.101.144	available (arn:aws:euare::404540521891:user/admin)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.101.145	available (arn:aws:euare::404540521891:user/admin)	standard				

I try running an instance as eucalyptus/admin and see the same failure. Best pass this on to [~sjones] for investigation since it seems fishy from an end-user perspective.
Please open an issue for this with steps to reproduce, there should not be system addresses associated with i-9429a89e and i-9fd04cfe if these instances are not running.
[~dkavanagh] Could you provide the steps to reproduce this for [~sjones]?
That's Jenny's cloud. I don't know exactly what she did. Assigning to her to document.
Taking a shot in the dark, but this could be due to a configuration error.  See EUCA-9154

[~alice] can you verify this is not due to an EDGE config error as referenced in EUCA-9154, please? I am not sure how to check that myself. 

If the config is fine, [~sjones] the best way to reproduce this is to log into 10.111.5.153:8888 using the browser of your choice (you can log in to account ui-test-acct-00, user admin, password mypassword0) or log in via euca2ools if you'd like, and try to run and instance. There is one instance running in account 00, that is  i-9fd04cfe, and two EIPs allocated to account 03 but unassociated with any instances. So there should be plenty of addresses available. All you have to do is try to run an instance. Should I convert this to a EUCA ticket if [~alice] verifies the config is ok (I suspect it is since we have an instance running already and I was able to run others prior)?
It appears you have two running instances and two allocated elastic IPs, as the cloud has four public addresses this means there are no public addresses available for use by instances.
[~sjones] So the system won't start an instance if I have allocated EIPs to an account, but they aren't associated with any running instances?
[~jloza], to release the two allocated addresses : https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#euca2ools-guide/euca-release-address.html

[~jloza], right, if there are no public addresses available you cannot run an instance (that needs a public address) even if you have an allocated elastic IP. You can run the instance without a public address and then associate the elastic IP if desired.
thanks [~kedwards], I just used the console to release them. :)
You're awesome, [~sjones]! Thank you SO MUCH. :)

Fix Verified

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.922.20140424git344494aa.el6

appropriate error message is displayed when short on resources
{code}
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-run-instances -k adminkey emi-0c579109 -n 9
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not enough resources available: addresses; please stop or terminate unwanted instances or release unassociated elastic IPs and try again, or run with private addressing only
{code}
